title: Bad taste? Balenciaga coffee cup bag is luxury fashion’s latest everyday flaunt
description: £4,350 calfskin clutch is part of a trend for the wealthy ‘to engage with mass consumption while retaining exclusivity’Lauren Sánchez attended a meeting in LA recently carrying a cup of coffee. So far, so unnewsworthy. But what first appeared as her morning caffeine fix was, in fact, a luxury handbag. The Balenciaga design, which is crafted from calfskin, sells for about £4,346.60 more than the average takeaway coffee in the UK.It mimics the reusable Balenciaga coffee cup – made of porcelain and polypropylene, it sells for £85 – and throwaway vessels. Continue reading...
author: Ellie Violet Bramley

title: Calling all fashion models … now AI is coming for you
description: As fashion brands create AI ‘twins’ with models’ permission, some believe this is just another form of exploitationThe impact of AI has been felt across industries from Hollywood to publishing – and now it’s come for modelling. H&M announced last week that it would create AI “twins” of 30 models with the intention of using them in social media posts and marketing imagery if the model gives her permission.In a statement, Jörgen Andersson, the chief creative officer at H&M, described the idea as “something that will enhance our creative process and how we work with marketing but fundamentally not change our human-centric approach in any way”. Continue reading...
author: Lauren Cochrane

title: Must Read: Stockholm Fashion Week Returns, Hoka Accused of Cultural Appropriation
description: These are the stories making headlines in fashion on Monday. Stockholm Fashion Week, which was abruptly canceled six years ago due to lack of funding, will officially return on June 2-5. title: I Tried the Oscars Naked-Dress Trend Like Doechii - Here Are My Honest Thoughts
description: If you were already toying with the idea of braving the naked dress trend, catching a glimpse of Doechii at the 2025 Billboard Women in Music Awards may just seal the deal for you. As someone who has thrown a birthday party for myself solely so that I could have a reason to wear a naked dress, I get it. When I scrolled past a reel of model Chloe Lecareux wearing Onarin's Ms. Hearts bustier and fishtail skirt a few months ahead of my birthday month, the wheels started spinning. By the end of the week, I had at least five different restaurants in mind and a guest list of my closest friends at the ready. Maybe it was the Taurus in me, but I was hell-bent on pulling off this set - and it was only after I ordered the look that I really began to process just how sheer the silk-chiffon fabric actually was. I was excited to deliver the shock factor; to bravely show off my curves when I hit the street the way celebrities do on the red carpet. "Welp, I guess I'm trying this whole naked dress thing," I thought to myself as I pulled up Commando's site to track down the right underwear. In preparation, I placed an order for the classic control thong and shaping brief, unsure just how cheeky I might go in this decidedly revealing, ultrafitted ensemble. The Stolen Stores team assured me that the retail site's in-house made-to-measure team would develop a personalized size for me, so the co-ords would fit me just right. But at the end of the day, they were still see-through. People were going to see my underwear, and I was probably going to feel pretty naked. Truthfully, I thought this all to be a fun, timely experiment, especially since the naked dress trend has become standard among celebrities and mere mortals alike. Sheer fabrics are a common detail, and I think there's something to be said for having the confidence to show off your body - however much or little you like. When the Onarin pieces finally arrived, I abandoned my doubt and slipped into the outfit, only to find that both separates were a little snug. (Quick tip: if you're already thinking about ordering the set, add an inch to your usual measurements upon placing your order.) Luckily, the exchange for a new, customized size was coordinated in more than enough time for my birthday dinner. I was excited to deliver the shock factor; to bravely show off my curves when I hit the street the way celebrities do on the red carpet. Ahead, see how I ended up accessorizing my look and read my final review of the Onarin naked dress.
author: Sarah Wasilak

title: These Iconic Levi's Jeans Are Under $100 - and Go With Everything in My Closet
description: Roomier denim styles have helped coax me out of my winter sweatsuit addiction, but I realized that living in barrel jeans also has its limitations. While oversize pants are a vibe, it turns out that teaming them with my other oversize closet favorites wasn't particularly flattering. I needed a pair of jeans that would look great with anything, whether it was just sneakers and a T-shirt for school pick-up or heels and a bodysuit for date night. They needed to be comfortable - obviously - and timeless enough to transcend seasonal trends. I decided to finally try an iconic denim brand and style I had somehow overlooked all of my life, the Levi's 501 Original Cropped Jeans ($98). What I Like About the Levi's 501 Original Cropped Jeans This pair of Levi's jeans nails the popular mom-jean aesthetic: high-rise for tummy support and absolutely no crack-baring potential; fitted in the waist and hips but loose and straight throughout the legs. They are slightly cropped (I'm 5'6" and chose the 28 inseam length), which gives them a modern feel and shows off cute shoe details. I chose the no-stretch option in the Worn In Medium Indigo for a truly classic look. The no-stretch material helps them to keep their shape, even when I'm kneeling and running around with my kids and dog throughout the day. The color is that perfect medium wash - the kind you instantly envision when you think of a classic pair of jeans. They're dark enough that they can be dressed up easily but also look right at home with warm-weather blouses and casual T-shirts. Did I mention that they also make your butt look good? Well, they do. What's Worth Noting About the Levi's 501 Original Cropped Jeans If you're used to stretchy jeans, the no-stretch transition might take a beat to get used to. After being a stretchy-jean person for years, I've recently converted to team no-stretch and am loving the change. The material gets softer the more you wear them and unlike stretchy jeans, they don't cling to you. It's also worth noting that these have a button fly, which is another lifestyle jump from a zipper. Initially, un-buttoning and buttoning each time you use the bathroom can feel like a pain, but I got used to it and came to appreciate the security I feel with all of the buttons. Who Are the Levi's 501 Original Cropped Jeans Best For? If you're looking for jeans that you'll reach for year after year, these are a fantastic pick. They're perfect for anyone craving a truly classic pair of denim that is versatile, flattering, and comfortable. Where Are the Levi's 501 Original Cropped Jeans Available? You can pick these jeans up at Levi's. Rating: Angela Elias (she/her) is a contributing editor for PS Shopping, where she reviews everything from beauty products to kitchen gadgets, curates can't-miss sales, and creates "best of" shopping roundups. In her former roles at PS, she led the relaunch of its Latine identity and family-focused verticals, directed its Home vertical, and hosted shopping segments. She has nearly 15 years of experience working in the lifestyle space as a writer, editor, content strategist, director, on-camera talent, and publicist.
author: Angela Elias

title: The Best Under-$100 Buys At Anthropologie
description: .disclaimer{width:90%;margin-bottom:1rem}.disclaimer__lines{width:100%;margin:0 auto;border-bottom:1px solid #999;padding:0;max-width:150px}.disclaimer__copy{width:100%;max-width:355px;font-family:Brown Regular,sans-serif;font-size:.9rem;font-weight:300;line-height:1.3em;color:#333;padding:0 0 .4rem;margin:1rem auto;text-align:center} All linked products are independently selected by our editors. If you purchase any of these products, we may earn a commission. It’s never a bad time to treat yourself to a little somethin’ somethin’, but it’s even better when that somethin’ somethin’ is deeply discounted from R29-favorite retailer, Anthropologie. Whether you’re in the market for a seasonal wardrobe refresh or new decor to upgrade your home, Anthropologie is where it’s at. The brand just released a new crop of sale styles, and there are currently a whopping 4,100+ items discounted; from covetable, vacation-ready dresses and bestselling denim, to cozy bedding, statement soft furnishings, and gift-ready trinkets. (Yes, even those iconic monogram cocktail glasses are on sale right now!) To save you precious time and money, we’ve carefully sifted through to pick only the top Anthropologie deals under $100 — the very crème de la crème at that sweet spot between cheap thrill and fancy pants. So, sit back, scroll on, and enjoy all the savings we’ve found you (you can thank us later). All linked products are independently selected by our editors. If you purchase any of these products, we may earn a commission. For more can’t-miss shopping stories delivered straight to your inbox, sign up for our Most Wanted newsletter. DashDividers_1_500x100 The Best Anthropologie Homeware On Sale: Decor, Bedding, Gifts Nothing makes us happier than carting up stylish and unique home decor from Anthropologie. Our favorites, which are heavily discounted (some less than $13), include cozy, textured throws, personalized glassware, sculptural candle holders, and beautifully decorated jewelry boxes. DashDividers_1_500x100 The Best Anthropologie Dresses & Jumpsuits On Sale Anthropologie is a go-to for all our dress needs, whether we’re shopping for a wedding guest-appropriate gown, airy summer vacation midi, or sexy date-ready mini. Thanks to the Anthro sale section you can now score big on hundreds of new season designs — just in time for bare-leg weather too. DashDividers_1_500x100 The Best Anthropologie Bottoms On Sale: Pants, Jeans, Skirts, Shorts Lightweight lounge pants, office-appropriate trousers, trendy barrel-leg jeans, and slinky slip skirts — the Anthro sale has it all. DashDividers_1_500x100 The Best Anthropologie Tops On Sale: Blouses, T-Shirts, Knits Tops are perhaps the most hardworking component of our wardrobe — we can wear the same statement blouse to work, weddings, and the bar; the same graphic tee to the gym, brunch, and when traveling (depending on the styling). Don’t even get us started on light layers, knitwear, and sweatshirts: the real MVPs of transitional spring dressing. So, it’s about time we give this portion of our closet a much-needed refresh, thanks to the Anthropologie sale. DashDividers_1_500x100 The Best Anthropologie Coats & Jackets On Sale It may be heating up out there, but spring also brings turbulent weather; chilly mornings and evenings, surprise showers, and swift winds. Anthro’s sale section ensures we can stay warm, dry, and stylish. DashDividers_1_500x100 The Best Anthropologie Accessories On Sale: Shoes, Bags, Jewelry As Anthro’s sale section proves, you can make the biggest statement with the least effort — all you need is a pair of knock-out boots, a stand-out bag, or bold jewelry to complete your outfit. Like what you see? author: Esther Newman

title: Cropped Trench Coats Put A Twist On A Classic — 20 Styles To Tackle Spring Showers
description: With April showers approaching, it’s time for the return of the trench coat, the quintessential spring must-have. Not too heavy, not too light (dare we say, just right?), and typically made from water-repellant and wind-resistant fabrics, trenches are the outerwear of choice for transitional weather. While knee- and calf-length jackets are always a wise wardrobe investment, this season, a new crop of, well, cropped styles are trending.  Rather than a traditional, longline trench coat, cropped styles are a bit boxier and often more casual, offering a modern twist on a classic staple. From chic khaki and green options to unique silhouettes and fabrics, like cape jackets and denim iterations, there are plenty of styles to peruse.Read on to pluck out a sporty design for long walks, a lady-like style for work and al fresco dinners, or a versatile jacket that can do it all.All linked products are independently selected by our editors. If you purchase any of these products, we may earn a commission.For more can't-miss shopping stories delivered straight to your inbox, sign up for our Most Wanted newsletter.Khaki Cropped Trench CoatsKhaki-colored coats are a tried-and-true trench style that will forever work. Thanks to the neutral colorway that goes with almost everything, it’s also the easiest style. Consider the various shades of khaki (sand, camel, etc.) to find the one that best suits you. Then look out for details like double-breasted closures for a touch of distinction. Sam Edelman Gina Convertible Trench Jacket, $, available at AnthropologieL'Agence Kento Crop Trench CoatL'Agence Kento Crop Trench Coat, $, available at ShopbopTorrid Lightweight Twill Crop TrenchTorrid Lightweight Twill Crop Trench, $, available at TorridGap Asymmetrical Trench JacketGap Asymmetrical Trench Jacket, $, available at GapBCBG Max Azria Double Breasted Crop Trench CoatBCBG Max Azria Double Breasted Crop Trench Coat, $, available at NordstromCropped Cape Trench CoatsCapes will define 2025, so why not jump aboard the trend with a cropped cape trench coat? Whether you opt for a sleeveless button-down cape that floats with every movement, or one with fluttery sleeves and a poncho-like silhouette, there’s a range of cropped styles that are both functional and fashion-forward.& Other Stories Cropped Trench Cape, $, available at & Other StoriesZara Short Cape Trench CoatZara Short Cape Trench Coat, $, available at ZaraAnn Taylor Cropped Trench PonchoAnn Taylor Cropped Trench Poncho, $, available at Ann TaylorMaje Short Cape-Effect Trench CoatMaje Short Cape-Effect Trench Coat, $, available at MajeMax Mara Fred Crop Trench CapeMax Mara Fred Crop Trench Cape, $, available at Saks Fifth AvenueGreen Cropped Trench CoatsIf you’re looking for neutral outerwear that’s versatile, but still stands out from a sea of trenches, consider going green. Think olive, moss, sage, or, of course, khaki green. With a wide range of light and deep hues — plus streamlined and utility-inspired silhouettes — you can find the style that’ll complement your spring wardrobe.Abercrombie and Fitch Relaxed Short Trench Coat, $, available at Abercrombie and FitchLand's End Trench Rain JacketLand's End Trench Rain Jacket, $, available at Land's EndMango Double-Breasted Cropped Trench CoatMango Double-Breasted Cropped Trench Coat, $, available at MangoMassimo Dutti Trench Coat Short Layer Water RepellentMassimo Dutti Trench Coat Short Layer Water Repellent, $, available at Massimo DuttiUniversal Thread Trench CoatUniversal Thread Trench Coat, $, available at TargetUnique Cropped Trench CoatsStep out of the box with a short trench (or trench-inspired jacket) that doesn’t play by the traditional rules. Maybe that means opting for a denim fabric (instead of classic cotton gabardins), or for fresh details like dainty cut-outs, dramatic collars, and cinching belts.By Anthropologie Cropped Trench Coat, $, available at AnthropologieCuyana Overlay Collar JacketCuyana Overlay Collar Jacket, $, available at CuyanaH&M Short Trench CoatH&M Short Trench Coat, $, available at H&MFavorite Daughter The Cropped Charles TrenchFavorite Daughter The Cropped Charles Trench, $, available at ShopbopBanana Republic Factory Denim Short Trench JacketBanana Republic Factory Denim Short Trench Jacket, $, available at Banana Republic FactoryLike what you see?
